chapter.title: What is new?
chapter.para: While a relatively young project, each version of Spring Dynamic Modules (even minor ones) offer new functionality. This chapter is a guide to the new and improved feature and intended as a high-level, short summary. Please follow the approapriate links for more in-depth information.

section.title: Web Support
section.para: The biggest feature of Spring Dynamic Modules 1.1.x version is the transparent support for web applications on OSGi platforms. By integrating directly with web containers (such as Apache Tomcat and Jetty), Spring-DM allows WARs depending on Servlet 2.5, JSP 2.1 and taglibs to be used with little or no effort at all. Please see for details.

section.title: Classpath Resource Abstraction
section.para: 1.1.x adds support for classpath: and classpath*: prefixes in the OSGi Resource abstraction. This allows the discovery of classpath resources (such as Spring's component scanning) to work out-of-the-box inside OSGi, across multiple bundles on multiple OSGi platforms. See for more information.

section.title: Plug-able Extender Configuration
section.para: 1.1.x makes it easy to change the default configuration for various extenders used by Spring-DM. By using fragments, users can customize the way bundles are started, what web container should be used for deployment or what thread-pool should be used for running Spring applications. explains the options in detail.
